text: Sampled from the tap at the brewpub. Pours a clear burnt orange with a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has and nice bread note with a slight sweetness and a bit of doughiness. Flavor has a nice lightly sweet bread note with a touch of grain backing.

Poured into a tall lager class at brewpub. White foamy head that laced nicely. Clear amber red color. Toasty and well balanced with a great finish. Clean flavors all around without a harsh booziness found in some maibocks.

Tap - small foamy head, nice medium copper color, creamy and balanced - mildly sweet malt and earthy and citrus hop notes, very good for a maibock

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Tap at the brewpub. Hazy copper pour with a monster frothy cream colored head. Sweet malty nose. Taste is dark fruits and a caramel sweetness. One of the better Maibocks Ive had for sure.

Pours a nice amber with a small off-white head. Aroma is rich fruit and wheat. Flavor is a lot of sweet fruit, berries and citrus with hints of toffee and sugary wheat. Medium body with soft carbonation and a nice creamy mouthfeel. Great brew.

Poured at tap room.  Pours a copper golden hue with thin  head.  Nice maibock beer

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Growler pour thanks to portableparty.  Clear dark amber pour, good carbonation and a sweet malty aroma. Flavor is caramelly malt, sweet brown sugar and slightly dry on the aftertaste.  A very good maibock, but not Barley Johns best offering.

Growler pour. Pour is clear copper with a sticky off white head that showed some lacing. Aroma is sweet spiced malt and faint bitterness. Taste is sweet and malty with a nice fruit and spice taste going on. Palate is medium and sticky and finishes dry. Solid, I like!

On tap at Barley Johns on 05/26/2009. Slightly hazy orange amber body with a small off-white head. Sweet fruity, toasty, and bready aroma. Sweet malty flavor with some fruit and some toasty and bready notes. Medium body with moderate carbonation.

Pale orange color, slightly hazy.  Very sweet aromas, mostly citrus and toffee.  Some smoky wood notes.  A bit of a resinous hop undercurrent supports an extra sugary maple wood taste.  Bright shades of orange.  Clean and rich palate.  Slightly too sweet for my taste but very drinkable.
On tap at pub. Deep amber with small head. Nice sweet citrus taste. Nice mouth feel.
Tap at brewpub. Amber body. Nose-floral hops with a little citrus. Taste-light citrus, dry leaf/sake like note, floral hops. Sweetness from the malt is kept well in check. Nicely done.
Tap @ brewpub.  A tannish brown color with an off-white head.  A big hint of mint in the flavor.  Good malty texture and well balanced.  Slightly dry.  Quite nice and unexpected.
Gitchee Gumee Brewfest 2005. Weak wafts of rich berry. Flavors are dominated by sugary wheat and some blackberry. This is a Maibock! I love that crisp, clean sweet sugary smack and finish. Nice brew!
Nice amber body, creamy off-white head that lasts. Sweet strawbeery and corn aroma. Hopped and overly sweet strawberries/raspberries. Fairly thick mouthfeel. Not bad.
Darkish amber body, wispy white head.  Smells like malty sweetcorn (but starchy and overripe).  Similar notes in the flavor except theres more bitter hops - watermelon rind and grass stem.
Orange Coloring. Frothy Head.  Orange Soda Flavor...Hops...Very Smooth.  Not too Bad, but not my Favorite.

Amber color with a little head.  Very malt aroma with a boat load of fuit.  I found this quite odd, but then the taste cleared that up.  More malt but the odd flavor seemed to be lemon and/or orange.  Never had a bock like this before, but it was quite tasty.  Sweet, but tasty.

Sample at the brewpub.  Deep molasses-apple nose, beautiful dark cherry color, huge sweet brown sugar in the initial flavor, sweet herbs...quite thick, with some vanilla and anise towards the end.  Too sweet for many Id expect, but I loved it.

Deep amber color with creamy head; slow moving bubbles in the body.  Mild, grassy aroma, somewhat caramelly in a English sort of way.  Notable sweet edge when drank side-by-side with their Barley Bitter.  Smooth and relatively clean; I like the sweet edge.  Didnt taste like 7% abv, no way.

Color is a solid haze of dark caramel copper with a very thin white head that fades to a thin ring and retains lots of stringy lace. One mighty fine looking Maibock! Smell is subdued dark fruits of raisin, fig, plum, and a slight sense of toffee. Taste is more of the same but much more improved upon fron the smell as it has a large variety of dark fruits, pale plum and raisin, with a mellow smooth toffeeness rendering it with a candied caramel, slightly sweet and finishes with a slight zip of tangyness. Feel is super silky smooth, light to medium body and goes down very easy, so much so its drinkablitiy is fantastic. Very good stuff. Although I think the ABV might be kinda high cuz this stuff went right to my head.
